title: ICE when compiling an FFI binding with a certain type

labels.name: A-linkage
labels.description: Area: linking into static, shared libraries and binaries

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
The following small binding produces an ICE:

``` rust
use libc::*;

pub struct KEYGEN {
    hash_algorithm: [c_uint]/2,
    count: uint32_t,
    salt: *c_void,
    salt_size: uint32_t,
}

extern {
    pub fn mhash_keygen_ext(++data: KEYGEN);
}
```

According to some comments in the IRC channel, the `++` mode is necessary to comply to the C ABI.

Trace:

